item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "I'm always happy," Sasha said. "Sometimes I just forget." -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by John Ruskin
item.description: "To banish imperfection is to destroy expression, to check exertion, to paralyze vitality." -- John Ruskin

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "I do things like get in a taxi and say, "The library, and step on it." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by Ishmael Reed
item.description: "No one says a novel has to be one thing. It can be anything it wants to be, a vaudeville show, the six o’clock news, the mumblings of wild men saddled by demons." -- Ishmael Reed

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "Make up a story... For our sake and yours forget your name in the street; tell us what the world has been to you in the dark places and in the light. Don't tell us what to believe, what to fear. Show us belief's wide skirt and the stitch that unravels fear's caul." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere." -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by A.M. Hargrove
item.description: "Maddie looked up to the ceiling and said, “Dear Lord, I have finally accepted that this man is not a figment of my imagination and that he is actually real. Now, I find out he is an alien from outer space. Are you kidding me?" -- A.M. Hargrove

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by A.M. Hargrove
item.description: "Ok. And we are getting there… how?” she inquired, her words dripping with skepticism. “Wait… don’t tell me. Your supersonic spaceship is parked outside the window waiting for us to jump aboard!” “No… we will not be using a Star Transporter today. Instead, we will be using a teleporting device. I must prepare you,” he replied so matter-of-factly." -- A.M. Hargrove

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by J.R. Rain
item.description: "A marriage shouldn't have to be so much work. Love shouldn't crush your soul. A relationship should add to your life, not take away from it." -- J.R. Rain

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by J.R. Rain
item.description: "I surveyed the others, who had all stopped in their tracks. "So what was the plan, boys? You were all going to get a fuck in? The very definition of sloppy seconds - hell, sloppy thirds and fourths and fifths. Than what? Slit my throat? Leave me for dead? Let some school janitor find me stuffed in a dumpster? You would deny my children their mother for one night of cheap thrills?" -- J.R. Rain

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "I was 32 when I started cooking; up until then, I just ate." -- Julia Child

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by Thomas Keneally
item.description: "Whoever saves one life, saves the world entire." -- Thomas Keneally

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by Anne Tyler
item.description: "I read so I can live more than one life in more than one place." -- Anne Tyler

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by Elizabeth George Speare
item.description: "What a pity every child couldn't learn to read under a willow tree..." -- Elizabeth George Speare

item.title: Fiona (Titch) add a quote by Bill Nye
item.description: "Everyone you will ever meet knows something you don't." -- Bill Nye
